case_vignette: a 15-year-old black man presents with a 1-year history of light spots on his back. the rash has grown slowly, with several new lesions appearing near the first one. it is not itchy or painful. he has not tried any treatments for this condition. he has no relevant medical history and none of his family members have similar skin findings. on examination, there are several well-demarcated depigmented macules and patches on his lateral back.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have light spots on my back that have been slowly increasing in number over the year.
Do these spots itch or cause any discomfort?
No, the spots are not itchy or painful.
Have you had any previous skin conditions or any other recent health issues?
No, I have no relevant medical history and no recent health issues.

The spots are well-defined and have not changed in color, they do not appear scaly or dry.
Do you have any family history of skin conditions or other significant diseases?
No, none of my family members have similar skin findings or relevant medical history.
What is your age and gender?
I am a 15-year-old male.
Final Diagnosis: Pityriasis Alba
